title: [Champion concept] GX-111, the Minion King (no stat growth)
body:
Hey, I have here what I think is a really cool champion idea that came out of nowhere.
First, a little background.
So it started off the way all good stories do: I was playing ranked. Just your average player trying to climb out of silver, and I came across a lot of Shaco players. I don't like Shaco, I find him to be a useless teamfighter and champion in general past the 15 minute mark. I was getting more and more annoyed, until I eventually told my duo buddy that I would genuinely rather have a player-controlled super minion than a Shaco. And that gave me the idea: why can't a minion be a champion? 
So here he is.
The release could be coupled with a story update centred on the origin of minions or something. His name is a reference to a production line, just as an example backstory.
He is about malphites size. He's a minion on steroids basically.
His base stats are going to be fairly high, but his stat growth will be very low, probably the lowest of all champions. This is because of his special passive:
Passive: the meek shall inherit
GX-111 has no level cap.
There are many ways of making an infinitely scaling champion, and this is another. Of course I'm tying in with the fact that all minions scale indefinitely. This could be unbalanced, fixable by lowering stat growth past level 18 or significantly decreasing experience gained post level 18. However, I think that having no passive for the first 30 minutes is a good trade-off, and this passive allows for useful synergies like Zilean's passive. 
Q: versatile combatant
No cost
Toggle
GX-111 can change forms between melee minion and ranged minion as he pleases. In melee form, he gains 10/15/20/25/30 armor, magic resist, and % attack speed. In ranged form, he gains 400 range and his basic attacks are all converted to magic damage, dealing 60/65/70/75/80% of his attack damage as magic damage in a small AoE(same as Kayle's E). 
To clarify, the ranged damage becomes his basic attack, it doesn't add on top of it, that would be stupid.
My idea behind this is that his melee form is his main duelling form, and his ranged form is used for early trading and late game split pushing. The magic damage is because it hurts minions more.
W: we are the 99%
40/50/60/70/80 mana
30/28/24/22/20 second cooldown
All nearby minions/monsters change focus to target champion for 1/1.5/2/2.5/3 seconds(including enemy minions). during this time, target is slowed by 5/10/15/20/25%. Basic attacks on enemy champions reduce the cooldown by 1 second.
This ability is meant to allow him to survive early laning. With some cooldown reduction and attack speed, it becomes his bread-and-butter anti-kiting weapon. It also works well with his E
E: of the minions, for the minions
20 second cooldown
50 mana at all ranks
Passive: nearby allied minions gain 20/25/30/35/40 armor and magic resist and 5/10/15/20/25 attack damage. 
Active: this bonus is tripled for 8/9/10/11/12 seconds.
This combos well with his w, and also contributes to his playstyle as a farm-centric late game duellist and split pusher, using minions to assist him in combat and pushing.
R: rise to power
100 mana
70/50/35 second cooldown
GX-111 channels the super minion within him, gaining 20/30/40% size, losing 15/10/5% movement speed, and gaining 50/100/150 attack damage for 10/15/20 seconds. In melee form, he keeps his bonuses, in ranged form, he uses a cannon and the AoE increases.
This is boss mode. Hitting the late game and being able to have this at 100% uptime is part of what makes this guy a late game hypercarry.

As you can see, his late game-centric passive, focus on minions(who are inherently weak early and strong late) pushes him towards being a top lane farmer, another sort of Nasus. However, high cooldowns and mana costs coupled with low base stats and lack of sustain should adequately allow most laners to squash him in extended trades. Contributing to team fights is not this guy's forte. He has low base movement speed, and little real cc, but with a heavy cc team he's basically another juggernaut. His niche(I know a couple other champions have it filled) is focused on farming it up, and split pushing the enemy into the ground, duelling anyone foolish enough to fight him, even turning minions against them.
Builds would probably be attack speed based and tanky, to take advantage of his on-hit cooldown and stat buffs. I know some people will find this champion boring, but this is the kind of champion I like playing.
Thanks for reading, I know,I've probably overturned the numbers a lot, but yeah, if you could rate it for me and give some constructive criticism I'd be a happy man.

replies.body:
Great champion idea, but are you seriously comparing Shaco to a "player controlled super minion". I mean I would accept you been mad that the enemy team had a Shaco, because of his massive gank potential and annoyance in team fights, but if you had that many Shaco's that were useless in team fights then it's either they weren't playing him right, or the team wasn't coordinating correctly. 

Shaco is always a good fighter and assassin, but he can perform well in team fights if played properly. His boxes are phenomenal crowd-control for initiation, and his clone fucks with people's mind so hard. He may not be the best actual team fighter once engaged, but he can start an initiation, take out a squishy, and get out for free.

Shaco is by no means useless past 15 minutes. As a matter of fact, he gets stronger at his job as the game goes on. Every champion has a role. Shaco is a assassin/fighter. Not all of these guys are meant to be fantastic at eliminating groups. In fact, I'm glad that players like you are still around thinking Shaco is bad, because then people can't ban him against me. The later the game gets, the more assassin and 1v1 potential Shaco has. 

Once he gets Shiv, Infinity Edge and Duskblade, there isn't much the enemy team can do to stop him, unless the Shaco is actually bad. That been said, there are a lot of bad Shaco players these days so I can see where you might get this hate for him. Oh and if I'm coming off douchly as Shaco wasn't the main topic of this article, I would appreciate it if you forget about this comment and NEVER ban Shaco in ranked.
I asked for feedback on my champion, not opinions on Shaco. I don't really care. Sorry.
Then don't mention that Shaco is a shitty champion in your post?

Sounds pretty darn cool, however, his ultimate should have  a longer cooldown at low levels but keep the ridiculously low cooldown at higher levels. I also wonder how neutral mobs respond to his w.
Good work.
All nearby jungle mobs also attack them for the duration.

so in other words, bait the jungler into a fight in top river and click w
they get baron aggro u win
By the time baron is up the jungler should be running around solo getting baited towards the pit

His E is probably broken. At lower ELO it probably wouldn't  matter too much, higher ELO would abuse it to hell. They removed the first minion wave from colliding with champions because that was considered broken in those ELOs, let alone a passive which basically makes your minions instantly win the lane.
Yeah i had a friend tell me they'd rather him not have a passive on that ability and just keep the active. Would that fix it?

more than likely not, its still a pretty spammable ability that makes it much harder for your opponent to cs, on top of the fact that minions that can hit that hard arent really minions anymore, it basically gets to the point where starved of gold and xp your oppenent leaves lane, finds a corner, curls up into a ball and cries

Seems good, intrigued as to how w interacts with neutral mobs (potential devourer jg). Passive seems to contrast with the whole late game scaling idea, perhaps very low base stats with escalating stat growth, maybe increases by 15% every 4 levels? His ultimate should have a much higher early game cooldown but keep the ridiculous late game strength. Idk. Apart from the above points, i think you have done a brilliant job so far.

Thanks for the feedback!
I like the passive idea. 
I dont know about the ult, because at early levels its a lot weaker and lasts a shoter duration, but maybe.

Truthfully don't even think this is the worst concept for a champion and I tihnk you did a decent job with the skills, it just seems really gimmicky with so much of his skills pertaining to minions. I'd keep the skill where it turns enemy minions against the target for a small time, that's a really cool feature and new to the game, but I think there's just way too much emphasis on the minions. The passive I also think is a bit ridiculous lol.

Thanks a lot for the feedback.
You reckon the passive's bad? Like overpowered bad? Hmm, I may have underestimated its strength, but there are some powerful passives in the game, and I feel like the long wait time for it to actually take effect, coupled with my suggestions about balancing it, may have made it balanced. Could be wrong of course.
